raw_answer.rationale: Two horizontal axes with different scales map to the same bars, creating dual-axis misrepresentation.

trace.model_output_excerpt:
THOUGHT: The chart shows two parallel scales on the same horizontal bars: a bottom numeric axis (0–160) and a top axis labeled with percentages (0%–100%). This hints at a dual-axis setup, which can mislead readers if both scales are presented over the same bars. I will run an axis localization on the x-axis to detect multiple axes and confirm dual-axis presence.

ACTION: {"tool":"axis_localizer","args":{"image":{"$ref":"state.current_image"},"axis":"x","axis_threshold":0.2}}

THOUGHT: The chart shows two horizontal scales (bottom 0–160 for counts and top 0–100% for percentages) on the same bars, indicating a dual-axis presentation. I will verify the top x-axis presence to confirm this misleader type.

ACTION: {"tool":"axis_localizer","args":{"image":{"$ref":"state.current_image"},"axis":"top_x","axis_threshold":0.15,"axis_tickers":[0,25,50,75,100]}}

observation.error: axis_localizer found no numeric tick candidates (engine=easyocr)

trace.error: axis_localizer found no numeric tick candidates (engine=easyocr)

observation.validation_error: Axis-based misleader labels require reliable axis evidence (axis_localizer with axis_present=true and >=3 ticks).

trace.model_output_excerpt:

ACTION: {"tool":"axis_localizer","args":{"image":{"$ref":"state.current_image"},"axis":"top_x","axis_threshold":0.2,"axis_tickers":[0,25,50,75,100]}}

observation.error: axis_localizer found no numeric tick candidates (engine=easyocr)
